LanguageData.DSC.ThanksText:
Thank you for installing Disco! I hope you enjoy it.
This may not be relevant to you right now, but if you are feeling depressed, anxious or unsure of yourself, please reach out to a loved one, a friend or someone you trust. This does not make you a burden. The way you may feel is not final and things will get better.
I wish you a pleasant day and I hope you have fun with my mod. Epicguru (James B)
LanguageData.DSC.PasteFile: Paste song file or folder path
LanguageData.DSC.AdjustSequenceWeights: Adjust sequence chances. Set chance to 0 to disable.
LanguageData.DSC.AdjustSongWeights: Adjust built-in song chances. Set chance to 0 to disable.
LanguageData.DSC.SongWeightsNote: Note: some songs will still play because they have their own sequence. Disable that sequence to fully remove the song. These sequences will be marked with [Music].
LanguageData.DSC.NoPowerWarning: DJ stand has no power! The disco will be cancelled if power is not restored soon!
LanguageData.DSC.NoPowerShutdown: DJ stand has no power, and it's internal battery ran out. The disco has been plunged into darkness and the dancers leave...
LanguageData.DSC.TriggerNowDesc: Try to start a disco right now. Can only be triggered once every 10 days.
LanguageData.DSC.TriggerNowDisabledCooldown: Cannot start now: has been manually triggered too recently. Wait a few days.
LanguageData.DSC.TriggerNowDisabledPower: Cannot start now: DJ stand has no power.
LanguageData.DSC.TriggerNowDisabledOther: Cannot start now: Possible causes - too much danger, not enough pawns, pawns are sleeping or drafted, disco floor too small...
LanguageData.DSC.ShuffleDesc: Move to next sequence. This will end the current sequence and choose a random new one. Good if you don't like the current song/floor effects
LanguageData.DSC.FloorTooSmall: Dance floor is too small! Must be at least 10 tiles.
LanguageData.DSC.FailedToStart: Failed to trigger disco. The map's current state may be preventing a disco from being held.
LanguageData.DSC.NoFloor: Must be placed on or directly adjacent to a dance floor.
LanguageData.DSC.NoPower: DJ stand has no power. Needs 50W when idle, {0}W when active.
LanguageData.DSC.DJArrived: The DJ has arrived. Lets get this party started!
LanguageData.DSC.SET.UseCustomVolumeDesc: If true, the disco music will use the Custom Volume setting. Otherwise, the music will use the base game music volume.
LanguageData.DSC.SET.CustomMusicVolumeDesc: The volume to use for disco music. Only has any effect if Use Custom Volume is enabled. Music volume is always affected by the Master Volume setting in Rimworld settings.
LanguageData.DSC.SET.DiscoFloorColorIntensityDesc: Controls the overall brightness of the disco floor effects.
LanguageData.DSC.SET.ManualTriggerCooldownDesc: The minumum time, in days, between manual disco activation. Click on the DJ stand to manually trigger a disco.
LanguageData.DSC.SET.DoLowPassDesc: Enables or disables the low-pass effect for disco music. The low-pass effect makes it seem like the music is being heard through a wall or from very far away (only applies when the camera moves away from the disco floor)
LanguageData.DSC.SET.DoReverbDesc: Enables or disables the reverb effect for disco music. The reverb effect makes it seem like the music is being played inside a room with a slight echo.
LanguageData.DSC.SET.GameSpeedAffectsMusicDesc: Should game speed affect the tempo and pitch of disco music, as well as the disco floor lights?
LanguageData.DSC.SET.WattsPerFloorTileDesc: When the disco is active, how much power each disco floor tile will consume.
